description:
Renders filtered list items.
Doesn't render its own HTML element.

If rendering a flat list, pass a function child to the `List` component instead, which implicitly wraps it.

Renders its children only when the list is empty.
Requires the `items` prop on the root component.
Announces changes politely to screen readers.
Renders a `<div>` element.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

initialFocus.description:
Determines the element to focus when the popup is opened.

- `false`: Do not move focus.
- `true`: Move focus based on the default behavior (first tabbable element or popup).
- `RefObject`: Move focus to the ref element.
- `function`: Called with the interaction type (`mouse`, `touch`, `pen`, or `keyboard`).
  Return an element to focus, `true` to use the default behavior, or `false`/`undefined` to do nothing.
initialFocus.name: initialFocus

type.name: boolean | RefObject<HTMLElement> | ((openType: InteractionType) => boolean | void | HTMLElement)

finalFocus.description:
Determines the element to focus when the popup is closed.

- `false`: Do not move focus.
- `true`: Move focus based on the default behavior (trigger or previously focused element).
- `RefObject`: Move focus to the ref element.
- `function`: Called with the interaction type (`mouse`, `touch`, `pen`, or `keyboard`).
  Return an element to focus, `true` to use the default behavior, or `false`/`undefined` to do nothing.
finalFocus.name: finalFocus

type.name: boolean | RefObject<HTMLElement> | ((closeType: InteractionType) => boolean | void | HTMLElement)

description:
A portal element that moves the popup to a different part of the DOM.
By default, the portal element is appended to `<body>`.
Renders a `<div>` element.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

keepMounted.description: Whether to keep the portal mounted in the DOM while the popup is hidden.
keepMounted.name: keepMounted

container.description: A parent element to render the portal element into.
container.name: container

description:
Positions the popup against the trigger.
Renders a `<div>` element.

anchor.description:
An element to position the popup against.
By default, the popup will be positioned against the trigger.
anchor.name: anchor

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.
className.name: className

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.name: render

sticky.description:
Whether to maintain the popup in the viewport after
the anchor element was scrolled out of view.
sticky.name: sticky

side.description:
Which side of the anchor element to align the popup against.
May automatically change to avoid collisions.
side.name: side

align.description: How to align the popup relative to the specified side.
align.name: align

positionMethod.description: Determines which CSS `position` property to use.
positionMethod.name: positionMethod

sideOffset.description:
Distance between the anchor and the popup in pixels.
Also accepts a function that returns the distance to read the dimensions of the anchor
and positioner elements, along with its side and alignment.

The function takes a `data` object parameter with the following properties:
- `data.anchor`: the dimensions of the anchor element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.positioner`: the dimensions of the positioner element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.side`: which side of the anchor element the positioner is aligned against.
- `data.align`: how the positioner is aligned relative to the specified side.
@example ```jsx
<Positioner
  sideOffset={({ side, align, anchor, positioner }) => {
    return side === 'top' || side === 'bottom'
      ? anchor.height
      : anchor.width;
  }}
/>
```
sideOffset.name: sideOffset

alignOffset.description:
Additional offset along the alignment axis in pixels.
Also accepts a function that returns the offset to read the dimensions of the anchor
and positioner elements, along with its side and alignment.

The function takes a `data` object parameter with the following properties:
- `data.anchor`: the dimensions of the anchor element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.positioner`: the dimensions of the positioner element with properties `width` and `height`.
- `data.side`: which side of the anchor element the positioner is aligned against.
- `data.align`: how the positioner is aligned relative to the specified side.
@example ```jsx
<Positioner
  alignOffset={({ side, align, anchor, positioner }) => {
    return side === 'top' || side === 'bottom'
      ? anchor.width
      : anchor.height;
  }}
/>
```
alignOffset.name: alignOffset

collisionBoundary.description: An element or a rectangle that delimits the area that the popup is confined to.
collisionBoundary.name: collisionBoundary

collisionPadding.description: Additional space to maintain from the edge of the collision boundary.
collisionPadding.name: collisionPadding

arrowPadding.description:
Minimum distance to maintain between the arrow and the edges of the popup.

Use it to prevent the arrow element from hanging out of the rounded corners of a popup.
arrowPadding.name: arrowPadding

disableAnchorTracking.description: Whether to disable the popup from tracking any layout shift of its positioning anchor.
disableAnchorTracking.name: disableAnchorTracking

collisionAvoidance.name: collisionAvoidance

description:
Groups all parts of the combobox.
Doesn't render its own HTML element.

Documentation: [Base UI Combobox](https://base-ui.com/react/components/combobox)

filter.description: Filter function used to match items vs input query.
filter.name: filter

type.name: (itemValue: Value, query: string, itemToString?: (itemValue: Value) => string) => boolean

open.description: Whether the popup is currently open. Use when controlled.
open.name: open

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.
disabled.name: disabled

grid.description:
Whether list items are presented in a grid layout.
When enabled, arrow keys navigate across rows and columns inferred from DOM rows.
grid.name: grid

inline.description: Whether the list is rendered inline without using the popup.
inline.name: inline

name.description: Identifies the field when a form is submitted.
name.name: name

loopFocus.description:
Whether to loop keyboard focus back to the input when the end of the list is reached while using the arrow keys. The first item can then be reached by pressing <kbd>ArrowDown</kbd> again from the input, or the last item can be reached by pressing <kbd>ArrowUp</kbd> from the input.
The input is always included in the focus loop per [ARIA Authoring Practices](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/combobox/).
When disabled, focus does not move when on the last element and the user presses <kbd>ArrowDown</kbd>, or when on the first element and the user presses <kbd>ArrowUp</kbd>.
loopFocus.name: loopFocus

modal.description:
Determines if the popup enters a modal state when open.
- `true`: user interaction is limited to the popup: document page scroll is locked and pointer interactions on outside elements are disabled.
- `false`: user interaction with the rest of the document is allowed.
modal.name: modal

defaultOpen.description:
Whether the popup is initially open.

To render a controlled popup, use the `open` prop instead.
defaultOpen.name: defaultOpen

onOpenChangeComplete.description: Event handler called after any animations complete when the popup is opened or closed.
onOpenChangeComplete.name: onOpenChangeComplete

items.description:
The items to be displayed in the list.
Can be either a flat array of items or an array of groups with items.
items.name: items

inputValue.description: The input value of the combobox. Use when controlled.
inputValue.name: inputValue

defaultInputValue.description:
The uncontrolled input value when initially rendered.

To render a controlled input, use the `inputValue` prop instead.
defaultInputValue.name: defaultInputValue

openOnInputClick.description: Whether the popup opens when clicking the input.
openOnInputClick.name: openOnInputClick

required.description: Whether the user must choose a value before submitting a form.
required.name: required

readOnly.description: Whether the user should be unable to choose a different option from the popup.
readOnly.name: readOnly

inputRef.description: A ref to the hidden input element.
inputRef.name: inputRef

filteredItems.description:
Filtered items to display in the list.
When provided, the list will use these items instead of filtering the `items` prop internally.
Use when you want to control filtering logic externally with the `useFilter()` hook.
filteredItems.name: filteredItems

virtualized.description: Whether the items are being externally virtualized.
virtualized.name: virtualized

limit.description: The maximum number of items to display in the list.
limit.name: limit

locale.description:
The locale to use for string comparison.
Defaults to the user's runtime locale.
locale.name: locale

multiple.description: Whether multiple items can be selected.
multiple.name: multiple

autoComplete.description:
Provides a hint to the browser for autofill.
@see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Reference/Attributes/autocomplete
autoComplete.name: autoComplete

autoHighlight.description: Whether the first matching item is highlighted automatically while filtering.
autoHighlight.name: autoHighlight

highlightItemOnHover.description:
Whether moving the pointer over items should highlight them.
Disabling this prop allows CSS `:hover` to be differentiated from the `:focus` (`data-highlighted`) state.
highlightItemOnHover.name: highlightItemOnHover

itemToStringLabel.description:
When the item values are objects (`<Combobox.Item value={object}>`), this function converts the object value to a string representation for display in the input.
If the shape of the object is `{ value, label }`, the label will be used automatically without needing to specify this prop.
itemToStringLabel.name: itemToStringLabel

itemToStringValue.description:
When the item values are objects (`<Combobox.Item value={object}>`), this function converts the object value to a string representation for form submission.
If the shape of the object is `{ value, label }`, the value will be used automatically without needing to specify this prop.
itemToStringValue.name: itemToStringValue

isItemEqualToValue.description:
Custom comparison logic used to determine if a combobox item value matches the current selected value. Useful when item values are objects without matching referentially.
Defaults to `Object.is` comparison.
isItemEqualToValue.name: isItemEqualToValue

defaultValue.description:
The uncontrolled selected value of the combobox when it's initially rendered.

To render a controlled combobox, use the `value` prop instead.
defaultValue.name: defaultValue

actionsRef.description:
A ref to imperative actions.
- `unmount`: When specified, the combobox will not be unmounted when closed.
Instead, the `unmount` function must be called to unmount the combobox manually.
Useful when the combobox's animation is controlled by an external library.
actionsRef.name: actionsRef

onOpenChange.description: Event handler called when the popup is opened or closed.
onOpenChange.name: onOpenChange

onInputValueChange.description: Event handler called when the input value changes.
onInputValueChange.name: onInputValueChange

onItemHighlighted.description:
Callback fired when an item is highlighted or unhighlighted.
Receives the highlighted item value (or `undefined` if no item is highlighted) and event details with a `reason` property describing why the highlight changed.
The `reason` can be:
- `'keyboard'`: the highlight changed due to keyboard navigation.
- `'pointer'`: the highlight changed due to pointer hovering.
- `'none'`: the highlight changed programmatically.
onItemHighlighted.name: onItemHighlighted

value.description: The selected value of the combobox. Use when controlled.
value.name: value

onValueChange.description: Event handler called when the selected value of the combobox changes.
onValueChange.name: onValueChange

type.name: (value: ComboboxValueType<Value, Multiple> | (Multiple extends true ? never : null), eventDetails: ChangeEventDetails) => void
